actions.name: RIG_VOLUME_BOOST

parameters.name: boost_volume
parameters.comment:
Boost volume: A value in range [0..1] (corresponding to the range of the
rig volume parameter of the Kemper. Some examples: 0.5 is 0dB, 0.625 is +3dB, 0.75 is +6dB, 1.0 is +12dB

parameters.name: remember_off_value
parameters.comment: If set, the boost will return to the former rig volume at disabling

actions.comment: Volume boost function, based on setting rig volume to a certain boost value.

actions.name: MORPH_BUTTON

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Can be "kemper" or a fixed color

parameters.name: morph_color_base
parameters.comment: Only used if color = "kemper". See MORPH_DISPLAY

parameters.name: morph_color_morphed
parameters.comment: Only used if color = "kemper". See MORPH_DISPLAY

actions.comment: Morph button (faded change of morph state)

parameters.name: morph_color_base
parameters.comment: Color used for the unmorphed state

parameters.name: morph_color_morphed
parameters.comment: Color used for the morphed state

actions.name: EFFECT_STATE
actions.comment: Switch an effect slot on / off

parameters.name: dim_factor
parameters.comment: Can be "off", "on" or a value in range [0..1]

parameters.name: led_brightness
parameters.comment: Can be "off", "on" or a value in range [0..1]

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Override color (if no color_callback is passed)

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (same as for RIG_SELECT, see definitions above)

parameters.name: preselect
parameters.comment: Preselect mode

parameters.name: display
parameters.comment: Reference to a DisplayLabel

parameters.name: dim_factor
parameters.comment: Can be "off", "on" or a value in range [0..1]

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: preselect

actions.name: RIG_SELECT_AND_MORPH_STATE

parameters.name: rig_off
parameters.comment: If set, this defines the "off" rig chosen when the action is disabled. Set to "auto" to always remember the current rig as "off" rig

parameters.name: bank
parameters.comment: If set, a specific bank is selected. If None, the current bank is kept

parameters.name: bank_off
parameters.comment: If set, this defines the "off" bank to be chosen when the action is disabled. Set to "auto" to always remember the current bank as "off" bank

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Color override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Text override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (show color/text for current or target rig)

parameters.name: morph_display
parameters.comment: Optional DisplayLabel to show morph color

parameters.name: morph_use_leds
parameters.comment: Use the LEDs to show morph state?

parameters.name: morph_id
parameters.comment: Separate ID for the morph action. Default is the same id as specified with the "id" parameter.

parameters.name: morph_only_when_enabled
parameters.comment: Only show the morph state when the "on" rig is selected

parameters.name: morph_color_base
parameters.comment: See MORPH_DISPLAY

parameters.name: morph_color_morphed
parameters.comment: See MORPH_DISPLAY

parameters.name: rig_btn_morph
parameters.comment: If set True, second press will trigger toggling the internal morphing state (no command is sent, just the displays are toggled). Only if no rig_off or bank_off are specified.

actions.comment: Adds morph state display on one LED to the rig select action.

parameters.name: keep_bank
parameters.comment:
If enabled, the bank is not changed when at the first and last rigs of a bank. If disabled, 
the banks are stepped up/down after the last/first rigs of a bank.

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (see definitions above)

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.comment: Color override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Text override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.comment:
If enabled, the bank is not changed when at the first and last rigs of a bank. If disabled, 
the banks are stepped up/down after the last/first rigs of a bank.

parameters.comment: Display mode (see definitions above)

parameters.name: color_callback

parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

actions.name: RIG_SELECT

parameters.name: rig_off
parameters.comment: If set, this defines the "off" rig chosen when the action is disabled. Set to "auto" to always remember the current rig as "off" rig

parameters.name: bank
parameters.comment: If set, a specific bank is selected. If None, the current bank is kept

parameters.name: bank_off
parameters.comment: If set, this defines the "off" bank to be chosen when the action is disabled. Set to "auto" to always remember the current bank as "off" bank

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (show color/text for current or target rig)

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Color override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Text override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: auto_exclude_rigs
parameters.comment: If rig_off is "auto", this can be filled with a tuple or list of rigs to exclude from "remembering" when disabled

parameters.name: rig_btn_morph
parameters.comment: If set True, second press will trigger toggling the internal morphing state (no command is sent, just the displays are toggled). Only if no rig_off or bank_off are specified.

actions.comment:
Selects a specific rig, or toggles between two rigs (if rig_off is also provided) in
the current bank. Rigs are indexed starting from one, range: [1..5].

actions.name: BINARY_SWITCH
actions.comment: Generic switch action which can be used for all parameter mappings

actions.name: EFFECT_BUTTON

parameters.name: num
parameters.comment: Number of the Effect Button (1 to 4)

parameters.name: use_internal_state
parameters.comment: If enabled, the state of the display will be toggled no matter what the real status on the Kemper is (the Kemper sadly does not report the state at all).

actions.comment:
Effect Button I-IIII (set only). num must be a number (1 to 4).
NOTE: The state of the display will be toggled no matter what the real status on the Kemper is (the Kemper sadly does not report the state at all). 
If you dont want this behaviour, you can set "use_internal_state = False".

actions.name: BANK_SELECT

parameters.name: bank
parameters.comment: Bank to select

parameters.name: bank_off
parameters.comment: "off" bank, to toggle between banks. Will be ignored when preselect is enabled.

parameters.name: preselect
parameters.comment:
If False, the bank is switched immediately (by sending a rig select command 
after bank preselect). If True, only the bank preselect is sent. Ignores bank_off.

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode

parameters.name: display
parameters.comment: Reference to a DisplayLabel

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: ID for paging / enable callbacks

parameters.name: use_leds
parameters.comment: Use the switch LEDs

parameters.name: enable_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback to enable/disable the action depeinding on things

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment:
Optional callback for setting the color. Scheme: 
def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are integers starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Static color (if no color callback is passed)

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment:
Callback for setting the text. Scheme: 
def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are integers starting from 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Static text (if no text callback is passed)

actions.comment:
Selects a specific bank, keeping the current rig, or toggles between two banks (if bank_off is also provided). 
Banks are indexed starting from one, range: [1..126].

actions.name: AnalogAction

parameters.name: mapping
parameters.comment: Parameter mapping to be controlled

parameters.name: max_frame_rate
parameters.comment: Maximum frame rate for sending MIDI values (fps)

parameters.name: max_value
parameters.comment: Maximum value of the mapping (16383 for NRPN, 127 for CC) Set this to None to auto-detect these ranges.

parameters.name: num_steps
parameters.comment: Number of steps to be regarded as different (saves MIDI traffic at the cost of precision).

parameters.name: enable_callback
parameters.comment: Callback to set enabled state (optional). Must contain an enabled(action) function.

parameters.name: auto_calibrate
parameters.comment: Auto-calibrate (similar to Kemper devices)

parameters.name: cal_min_window
parameters.comment: Minimum calibration range in percent [0..1]. A value of 0.25 means that the pedal has to cover at least 25% of the full range to be regarded.

parameters.name: transfer_function
parameters.comment:
Transfer function. Input is the raw encoder value in range [0..65535]. Must return the value to be sent for 
the mapping, in its range. If used, this disables the num_steps and max_value parameters.
NOTE: When designing your transfer function, take care that the output values do not change too often as this 
imposes performance issues!

actions.comment: Use this action for all analog inputs like expression pedals.

actions.name: EncoderAction

parameters.name: mapping
parameters.comment: Parameter mapping to be controlled

parameters.name: max_value
parameters.comment: Maximum value of the mapping (set to None for auto-detect: 16383 for NRPN, 127 for CC)

parameters.name: step_width
parameters.comment: Increment/Decrement for one encoder step. Set to None for auto-detect (NRPN: 160, CC: 1)

parameters.name: enable_callback
parameters.comment: Callback to set enabled state (optional). Must contain an enabled(action) function.

actions.comment:
Use this action for all rotary encoders like wheels. The push-down switch of the encoder is 
not addressed here: This is represented as a separate switch, and can be linked to the same actions as a normal foot switch.

actions.name: PagerAction

parameters.name: pages
led_brightness
parameters.comment: LED brightness for the action (fixed) in range [0..1]

parameters.name: mappings
parameters.comment: List of mappings the paging depends on (optional)

actions.comment:
The PagerAction is used to control multiple other actions to provide paging for specifiec actions.
Define this action for one switch, and select it in the actions to control by setting the 
enable_callback parameter and page ID for those actions.
